prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three shars:
1. green bell pepper
2. potato
3. eggplant

Now pick out the other shars from the following list:
1. pumpkin
2. bee
3. green bell pepper
4. crane
5. basset hound
6. full-trailer truck
7. Labrador
8. eggplant
9. yellow bell pepper
10. bear
11. loader
12. car
13. box truck
14. school bus
15. carrot
16. red bell pepper
17. onion
18. cat
19. chiller truck
20. Dalmatian
21. seal


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. motorcycle and cat
2. pumpkin and bear
3. terrier and carrot
4. motorcycle and pig
5. mutt and yellow bell pepper
6. bear and yellow bell pepper
7. onion and crane
8. chiller truck and yellow bell pepper
9. onion and bee
10. loader and chiller truck
11. eggplant and green bell pepper
12. tractor and toucan
13. car and toucan
14. semi-trailer truck and green bell pepper
15. red bell pepper and cat
16. cat and box truck
17. chiller truck and toucan
18. bee and carrot
19. bear and Labrador
20. tractor and eggplant
21. pumpkin and red bell pepper
22. loader and carrot
23. seal and toucan
24. pumpkin and green bell pepper
25. garbage truck and tractor
26. red bell pepper and bear
27. yellow bell pepper and car
28. chiller truck and pig
29. Labrador and potato
30. seal and yellow bell pepper
31. Dalmatian and chiller truck
32. mutt and school bus
33. bear and basset hound
34. basset hound and pig
35. school bus and carrot
36. pumpkin and yellow bell pepper
37. garbage truck and Labrador
38. chiller truck and terrier
39. tractor and Labrador
40. eggplant and cat
41. full-trailer truck and box truck
42. potato and chiller truck
43. seal and red bell pepper
44. loader and crane
45. red bell pepper and Labrador
46. Dalmatian and toucan
47. tractor and bear
48. potato and basset hound
49. garbage truck and Dalmatian
50. garbage truck and cat


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.

results.choice_explanation: The word 'shars' likely refers to vegetables or similar food items based on the given examples. Therefore, items from the list that are vegetables or closely resemble vegetables in nature were chosen.
